full_summary:
# Construction and Interpretive Display Installation Contract Invitation to Qualify (ITQ)

## Statement of Work

The Government of Canada, represented by Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC), invites qualified contractors to participate in a two-phase competition for the fabrication and installation of interpretive displays at the Last Mountain Lake National Wildlife Area Interpretive Pavilion.

### Location

The project site is located at the Last Mountain Lake National Wildlife Area, Simpson, Saskatchewan (P.O. Box 280, S0G 4M0).

### Purpose

The purpose of this project is to design, fabricate, and install interactive displays in an existing building on site. The displays will feature Indigenous knowledge and language and will require review and revision with First Nations throughout the construction process.

### Scope of Work

The contractor will be responsible for providing all necessary labor, materials, and equipment to:

* Design and fabricate interactive displays, cabinetry, and artistic elements
* Install the displays, including graphic panels, and technological elements
* Ensure the displays are robust enough to withstand high-touch use by the public

### Requirements

* The contractor must have a minimum of two years of experience in similarly complex projects.
* The contractor must have a team of skilled professionals, including designers, fabricators, and installers.
* The contractor must be able to work collaboratively with ECCC and stakeholders to ensure the project meets the required standards.

### Site Visit

A mandatory site visit is scheduled as part of Phase 2 of the tender process.

### Delivery Date

The delivery date will be determined mutually between ECCC and the contractor, considering lead times for delivery of construction materials, weather conditions, and site restrictions.

### Estimated Value

The estimated value of the project is between $100,000.00 and $200,000.00 (excluding taxes).

### Contact Information

For further information, please contact Shawn Davis at shawn.davis@ec.gc.ca or (873) 500-0215.

## Important Details

* This is an Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) tender.
* The tender process is open to qualified contractors who meet the minimum requirements.
* The pre-qualification list will expire after the contract is awarded in Phase 2.
